featureDescription.name: position
featureDescription.description: F1-The position of “it” in the sentence considering the number of tokens, e.g., “it” is the first token in the sentence “It was raining!”, so the value of this feature for our example sentence is 1.

featureDescription.name: sentLenInTokens
featureDescription.description: F2-The length of the sentence in terms of tokens, e.g., “It was raining!” has four tokens, so the value is 4.

featureDescription.name: numPunct
featureDescription.description: F3-The number of punctuations, e.g., “It was raining!” has one punctuation mark, so the value is 1.

featureDescription.name: numPrecedingNP
featureDescription.description: F4-The number of preceding noun phrases (that is: how many noun phrases come before a certain instance of “it”?) For F4, we count only the atomic noun phrases.

featureDescription.name: numFollowingNP
featureDescription.description: F5-The number of noun phrases that follow a given instance of “it”. Like in F4, F5 is concerned with atomic noun phrases.

featureDescription.name: followsPrepPhrase
featureDescription.description: F6-Does the pronoun “it” immediately follow a prepositional phrase? (Yes/No)

featureDescription.name: fourPosTagsPrecedingFollowing
featureDescription.description: F7-The part-of-speech (POS) tags of the four tokens immediately preceding and the four tokens immediately succeeding a given instance of “it”. If there are less than four tokens before/after, assign a special value, e.g., ABS (absent) to the missing POS tags.

featureDescription.name: followedByVBG
featureDescription.description: F8-Is the occurrence of “it” followed by an -ing form of a verb? (Yes/No)

featureDescription.name: followedByPrep
featureDescription.description: F9-Is the occurrence of “it” followed by a preposition? (Yes/No)

featureDescription.name: numFollowingAdj
featureDescription.description: F10-The number of adjectives that follow the occurrence of “it” in the sentence.

featureDescription.name: followsVerb
featureDescription.description: F11-Is the pronoun “it” preceded by a verb? (Yes/No)

featureDescription.name: followedByVerb
featureDescription.description: F12-Is the pronoun “it” followed by a verb? (Yes/No)

featureDescription.name: followedByAdj
featureDescription.description: F13-Is the pronoun “it” followed by an adjective? (Yes/No)

featureDescription.name: followedByNPAdj
featureDescription.description: F14-True if there is a noun phrase coming after the pronoun “it” and that noun phrase contains an adjective, otherwise false.

featureDescription.name: numTokensPrecedingFollowingInfinitiveVerb
featureDescription.description: F15-The number of tokens coming before the following infinitive verb (if there is one), otherwise 0.

featureDescription.name: numTokensUntilNextPrep
featureDescription.description: F16-The number of tokens that appear between the pronoun “it” and the first following preposition (if there is a following preposition), otherwise 0.

featureDescription.name: followedBySeqAdjNP
featureDescription.description: F17-True if there a sequence “adjective + noun phrase” following the pronoun “it”, and false otherwise.

featureDescription.name: depRelType
featureDescription.description: F18-The dependency relation type with the closest word to which “it” is associated as a dependent.

featureDescription.name: nextFollowingVerbInWeather
featureDescription.description: F19-True if the immediately following verb belongs to the category “weather adjectives”, and false otherwise.

featureDescription.name: nextFollowingVerbInCognition
featureDescription.description: F20-True if the immediately following verb belongs to the category of cognitive verbs, and false otherwise.
